snippet: A ruling in Maryland has turned the spotlight on diversification of historically black colleges.
abstract: Federal court in Maryland rules that state has allowed traditional universities to unnecessarily duplicate programs offered by black colleges, hurting their ability to attract white students and furthering segregation; decision highlights diversification of historically black colleges.
lead_paragraph: A ruling in Maryland has turned the spotlight on diversification of historically black colleges.

headline.seo: Maryland’s Black Colleges Fight for Equity
